headline: No More CME Gap? CME Group Launch 24/7 Trading
summary: Bitcoin is facing a turbulent week, slipping toward critical support levels as global markets react to rising geopolitical fears. While gold and oil are surging on reports of imminent escalation in the Middle East, we are seeing a classic Bitcoin risk-off move. Furthermore, US spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded its largest ...

headline: CME Will Make Crypto Derivatives Trading 24/7 in May as Wall Street Eyes Similar Goal
summary: Top derivatives marketplace CME will adopt 24/7 crypto trading on May 29, pending regulatory approval. The CFTC has indicated it supports such moves.

headline: CME Group to offer 24/7 trading for crypto derivatives starting May 29
summary: Investing.com -- CME Group Inc (NASDAQ:CME) will soon allow cryptocurrency futures and options to trade 24 hours a day, seven days a week, bringing its offerings closer to the always-on model of crypto markets.

headline: Fed Economists Say Kalshi Could Become The New Bloomberg For Macro Forecasting
summary: Kalshi beats Wall Street forecasts on economic data in real time. Kalshi's rate predictions have a perfect track record before FOMC meetings since 2022, affecting stocks like Robinhood, Coinbase, DraftKings, and Flutter Entertainment.

headline: CME Group Product Expansion Tests Valuation With New Futures Range
summary: CME Group is rolling out new futures products, including upcoming contracts on South Asian edible oils. The company has recently added cryptocurrency futures products and is preparing to introduce single stock futures. These launches expand CME Group's reach across commodities, digital assets, and equity derivatives. CME Group, NasdaqGS:CME, is leaning into product expansion as a key theme, with its shares recently trading at $302.55. The stock has returned 12.2% year to date, 23.0% over...

headline: FTSE 100 LIVE: Stocks slump as miners and British Gas owner Centrica pull London lower
summary: Centrica announced it was stopping share buyback plans after it suffered a 39% drop in profits for full-year 2025.
